meanings.definition: Capable of soothing or relieving pain.
meanings.sent1: The soft music had an anodyne effect on the patients in the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The gentle massage provided an anodyne relief to the sore muscles.
meanings.sent3: The calming tea acted as an anodyne for the stressed-out students before the exam.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words were an anodyne balm to his wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The warm bath with lavender oil was an anodyne experience after a long day.

meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed an anodyne to manage the patient's chronic pain.
meanings.sent2: She always kept an anodyne in her purse for sudden headaches.
meanings.sent3: The bitter taste of the anodyne made the child scrunch up his face in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The anodyne worked like magic, easing the pain within minutes.
meanings.sent5: The herbal anodyne was a lifesaver during the camping trip when someone got injured.

meanings.sent1: The sound of rain falling outside was an anodyne for her anxious mind.
meanings.sent2: A walk in the park served as an anodyne after a stressful day at work.
meanings.sent3: His favorite book was his go-to anodyne whenever he felt overwhelmed.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children playing acted as an anodyne to the tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset was an anodyne for the soul, bringing peace and tranquility.
